New Records: Alex Hales made a comeback fifty after 1291 days since his last appearance for England.
Luke Wood made his debut for England and performed well with 3 wickets for 24 runs.
Key Match Events: Alex Hales scored 53 off 40 balls to anchor England's chase.
Pakistan's top order struggled, with Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan failing to continue their partnership beyond 85 runs.
Luke Wood took his first international wicket and contributed to England's win.
Pre-Game Insights: Alex Hales' return was a significant moment for England after a long absence.
England's team changes included debuts for Luke Wood and Shan Masood.
Post-Match Reflections: Alex Hales' performance was crucial for England's victory.
Pakistan's reliance on their top three batters for most of the innings was noted as a concern.
